section.para: The module enables you, on behalf of your company, to create credit notes from your seller.
In this chapter, we use the terms importer and buyer interchangeably, and we use the terms exporter and seller interchangeably,

section.title: Terminology
section.para: Within this section of the help guide, the terms "CN" and "Credit Note" are used interchangeably. The terms "record" and "transaction" both refer to entries in the system relating to the function being discussed.

section.title: Counterparty Access
section.para: If your company (the Buyer) is not an existing user of , your Seller can arrange for you to have limited access to to use the modules.
When your Seller arranges for you to have access to , they should let you know the credentials (user ID, password, and abbreviated name for your company) you can use to log on.
Where a function may not be present if you have limited counterparty access, this chapter says so.

section.title: Functions
section.para: In this module you can do the following:

listitem.para: Enter the details of a , validate these details, and send the transaction to the Bank. This function may not be present if you have limited counterparty access.
Display a list of all s that are still pending, which means s that have been initiated but not yet internally approved.
Browse through all your company's existing s to review their details or history, and optionally print a hard copy of their transaction data.
Delete s to clean up your workspace of outdated or incomplete transactions. This function may not be present if you have limited counterparty access.

Define the sections to be included in the CN Initiation form, and the formats available for the files you will upload in the Upload function. This function may not be present if you have limited counterparty access.

section.title: CN Initiation - From Template
section.para: The "From Template" option allows a previously created template to be used as a basis for a new . To create a template, either enter the known details into a scratch form, or use the "Copy from CN" option to create a new one, and remove the fields that are likely to change each time the template is used.
Enter the name of the template in the Template ID field, and click on the Template button at the top (or bottom) of the screen).
To use the template, select this option and a list of existing templates will be displayed.
The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the Reference, Entity or Description field. To display all templates, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.

section.title: CN Initiation - Edit Transactions
section.para: This option allows records that you or another user have already started and saved, to be completed.

When selected, this option will present a list of records that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but not yet submitted to the clients because the input user either did not try to submit or had insufficient privileges.
Click in the System Id column to open a message for further editing.

section.title: CN Initiation - Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: This option allows records that you or another user have already started but been unable to submit, to be submitted by an authorised user.

When selected, this option will present a list of records that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but have not been successfully submitted to the clients because the user had insufficient privileges. Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included.
Click in the System Id column to open the record in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission.

If you have sufficient authorisation in your profile, you can submit multiple records in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which you tick to select it. A button at the end of the page submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.

section.title: Messages - Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: This option allows acceptance and resubmission records that you or another user have already started but been unable to submit, to be submitted by an authorised user.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.

section.title: Pending CNs
section.para: Display a list of your company's s that are pending. This is typically used by a manager to monitor the consolidated list of s received but not yet submitted. It also gives quick access to the actions required to interact with a given transaction record. Therefore, depending on the state of the record, you can open the record either in edit mode or in review/signature mode (only if it has been submitted before but is still pending for additional credentials).
The list displays CNs of types:
and whose transaction status are:

listitem.para: Incomplete (the input user saved it as a draft, using Save; it could be retrieved using the Retrieve Draft menu item)
Uncontrolled (the input user tried to submit it, using Submit, but did not have sufficient privilege; it could be retrieved using the Retrieve Unsigned menu item)

section.para: This list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System Id, Entity, Credit Note Reference, Seller Name or CCY field. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
There is also a field where you can select an Output Format for the results:

(History) Display a list of all events for the record, detailing the complete history of the file. For each event in the life of the file, the list shows the Release Date, the Type of the event, the Status, the Currency and transaction Amount (for example, the transaction amount), and the identities of the input and supervising users.

section.para: On the History page, you can click in the Release column to open a popup window showing full details of each event. Within the popup, the Event Details section shows the key details of the event. It shows any additional instructions and attachment provided by the customer as well as the bank's comment and attachments given as part of the reporting.

If the Event Details header in the popup window shows a Release Date/Time, it means the time the validated transaction event was released by the buyer to the seller.
The timestamp is shown in user timezone by default. However, it can be changed by setting the property display.datetime.in.user.timezone to 'False' which shows the bank timezone. Banks which want to retain the earlier configuration need to set the listed property to 'False' as well.

The Date/Time field that accompanies a Message header means the time the reporting message was released by the seller to the buyer.
The timestamp is shown in user timezone by default. However, it can be changed by setting the property display.datetime.in.user.timezone to 'False' which shows the bank timezone. Banks which want to retain the earlier configuration need to set the listed property to 'False' as well.

You can also export the history report as an external file in CSV format, by choosing CSV in the Output Format list box and clicking the icon
. The name of the file downloaded is the System Id of the transaction together with a .csv extension - for example, if the CN has the system identifier CN0110001008., the filename is CN0110001008.csv.

section.title: CN Maintenance - Rejected CNs
section.para: List and optionally delete Rejected transactions.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that were submitted, but rejected by the bank and have a status of "Not Processed". You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.
